alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; Laramie Valley; North Laramie Range; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 20 at 5:32PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Carbon and central Albany Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 529 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Hanna to 6 miles south of Medicine Bow to 10 miles southeast of Arlington. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Mesonet observations. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong crosswinds along Interstate 80 near Arlington and Elk Mountain and US-30 near Rock River could be hazardous to light, high-profile vehicles. Locations impacted include... Hanna, Medicine Bow, Rock River, Elk Mountain, Battle Mountain, Bosler, Wheatland Reservoir 3 and Arlington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
